definition: see 喪家之犬|丧家之犬[sang4 jia1 zhi1 quan3]
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
mourning/funeral/(old) corpse

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
dog/CL:隻|只[zhi1],條|条[tiao2]
Confucius
Zi Lu (542-480 BC), disciple of Confucius 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3], also known as Ji Lu 季路[Ji4 Lu4]
lit. a monkey wearing a hat (idiom)/fig. worthless person in imposing attire
Zi Gong or Duanmu Ci 端木賜|端木赐[Duan1 mu4 Ci4] (520 BC-), disciple of Confucius
to travel around many countries (idiom); peregrinations/refers to the travels of Confucius
Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]
another name for Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3]
Yan Hui (521-481 BC), disciple of Confucius, also known as Yan Yuan 顏淵|颜渊[Yan2 Yuan1]
scared out of one's wits (idiom); in a panic
to rub one's head and heels (idiom); to slave for the benefit of others/to wear oneself out for the general good
Mencius 孟子 (c. 372-c. 289), Confucian philosopher
Su Qin (340-284 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
dried bones in burial mound (idiom); dead and buried
Lord Menchang of Qi, Chancellor of Qi and of Wei during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
to lose the way/unjust/moral failing
Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
